channel.title: Throw :: Introduction to Web Dev
channel.description: In most programming languages, when the compiler or interpreter encounters code it doesnâ€™t know how to handle, it throws an exception. This is how the compiler notifies the programmer that something has gone wrong. Throwing an exception is also known as raising an exception. JavaScript gives us the ability to raise exceptions using the throw statement. One reason to throw an exception is if your code is being used in an unexpected way.
